title: Photos: Costumes and characters abound in Salem ahead of Halloween
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Community The misty weather did not deter Halloween fans from Salem on Wednesday.
Gary, of Salem, dressed as the Mad Hatter from Alice in Wonderland.
His jacket is one of the 12 original jackets made for the film, he said.

title: Here’s what Boston meteorologists are saying about Thursday’s rain and the forecast for Halloween
author: Heather Alterisio
bullets: Weather "Rain moves out around sunrise Friday so it will be dry for Halloween but WINDY.
" ShareSend this article to your social connections.

National Weather Service: ‘A period of moderate to heavy rainfall will be possible Thursday night into early Friday morning’ A quick-hitting system will bring widespread rainfall to southern New England Thursday afternoon through Friday morning.

title: Boston Scientific named best Massachusetts employer for career growth, survey finds
author: Frances Klemm
bullets: Jobs A new survey by Careerminds shows workers are more loyal to companies that offer transparent career paths and skill-building opportunities.
Boston Scientific in Marlborough.
Lane Turner/Globe Staff Opportunities to build diverse skills are among the most desirable traits in an employer, according to a new national survey by Careerminds.

title: Boston’s hottest ticket? A bar seat for a lecture from a professor.
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Local News Lectures on Tap series brings professors and other experts into Boston restaurants and bars for talks that mix big ideas with food and drink.
Lectures on Tap, an event series, brings ticketed lectures from local professors and experts to restaurants instead of classrooms, pairing big ideas with food and drink.
(John Tlumacki/Globe Staff) By Annie Jonas October 30, 2025 | 5:00 AM 1 minute to read ShareSend this article to your social connections.

title: What Jaylen Brown said about calling LeBron James for hair advice on his livestream
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Boston Celtics Brown had a mishap during the Knicks game last week.
So, he called on a fellow NBA star for help.
The Boston Celtics' Jaylen Brown sits on the bench during the second half of a preseason game against the Cleveland Cavaliers, Sunday, Oct.

title: Jaylen Brown’s big night leads Celtics to statement win over Cavaliers: Takeaways
author: Tom Westerholm
bullets: Boston Celtics Wednesday’s win said quite a bit about this team, even if the individual bullet points were things we already knew.

title: Weighing the pros and cons of a Pavel Zacha trade for the Bruins
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Boston Bruins Dealing away Zacha could net Boston a substantial return at some point this season.
Pavel Zacha (right) could be a top trade chip for the Bruins this season.

title: Quincy mayor proposes reduced raise after backlash over 79 percent increase
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Local News The proposal will revise Mayor Thomas Koch’s expected raise from $285,000 to $225,000 when it takes effect in 2028.
Quincy Mayor Thomas Koch has revised his proposal for a raise for 2028 after the initial raise was met with backlash.
Pat Greenhouse/The Boston Globe ShareSend this article to your social connections.

title: Falcons coach compares Drake Maye to reigning NFL MVP
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: New England Patriots “His mobility, his arm strength, the way he can take a game over with both facets of the game.
So he's going to be — he's a problem.
” Josh Allen was handed a loss by Drake Maye and the Patriots earlier this month.

title: Brad Marchand steps away from the Panthers to help a friend whose daughter died of cancer
author: The Associated Press
bullets: NHL Marchand served as a guest coach Wednesday night for the under-18 March and Mill Co.
Hunters in his hometown of Halifax, Nova Scotia, in place of friend JP MacCallum.
Florida Panthers left wing Brad Marchand taps his heart during a standing ovation during a break in the first period of a game, Tuesday, Oct.
